title: How to Get Out of a Westgate Timeshare Mortgage

steps.title: Use a deed transfer to get rid of your timeshare deeds and no longer be responsible for the payments.
steps.content: Use a deed transfer to get rid of your timeshare deeds and no longer be responsible for the payments. [1] X Research source To transfer your Westgate Resorts timeshare deed, you must meet a couple of qualifications: your timeshare must be completely paid off, and you must be up to date on your maintenance fees or any other payments. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Find a reputable deed transfer company to help.
steps.content: Find a reputable deed transfer company to help. Try looking on the Better Business Bureau website by searching for "Timeshare Deed and/or Title Transfer" .

steps.title: Do a timeshare donation.
steps.content: Do a timeshare donation. This is another option to get rid of your timeshare. A donation works by allowing you to donate your timeshare to a charity for them to use, so you don't have to pay maintenance fees anymore.

steps.title: Meet the requirements.
steps.content: Meet the requirements. As with a deed transfer, your timeshare must be paid off in full and you must be up to date on your maintenance fees and payments to donate your timeshare. And don't let the word "donation" fool you; even though you're giving the timeshare to charity, you might still have to pay to donate the timeshare.

steps.title: Get assistance from different companies.
steps.content: Get assistance from different companies. [3] X Research source There are different options for donating your timeshare, so approaching several companies is a good idea.

steps.title: Use the cooling-off period.
steps.content: Use the cooling-off period. Every timeshare contract allows for a cooling-off period called a rescission period. It varies state to state, but if you are still within that rescission period, you can easily and quickly get out of your timeshare contract without dealing with any third parties. [4] X Research source This wikiHow page will show you how.

steps.title: Resell the timeshare.
steps.content: Resell the timeshare. Most timeshares sell for a pitiful fraction of their original cost on the resale market. [5] X Research source And that is if they sell at all. There are hundreds of listings for timeshares on marketplace websites such as eBay, some going for as low as one penny.

steps.title: Be wary of whom you deal with.
steps.content: Be wary of whom you deal with. If you do want to resell your timeshare, be very wary of timeshare resale companies. They are notorious for scamming unwitting timeshare owners by charging upfront fees, then disappearing. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Cancel the timeshare.
steps.content: Cancel the timeshare. Timeshare cancellation is a different process than a deed transfer or timeshare donation. You do not need to have your timeshare paid off, or be up to date on your maintenance fees. Timeshare cancellation works by using consumer rights violations to cancel a timeshare contract. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Meet the right conditions.
steps.content: Meet the right conditions. To be a candidate for a timeshare cancellation, you must have been the victim of lies or misrepresentations in the purchase of your timeshare. Some of the biggest lies timeshare salespeople tell are that buying a timeshare is an investment and that the timeshare will increase in value, that the price of the timeshare you are being offered is a "once in a lifetime opportunity", and that you'll be able to rent your timeshare out when you aren't using it to make money.

steps.title: Find a timeshare cancellation company that is accredited with the Better Business Bureau to help cancel your Westgate timeshare.
steps.content: Find a timeshare cancellation company that is accredited with the Better Business Bureau to help cancel your Westgate timeshare. BBB accreditation is a good indicator of a legitimate business.
